text:
Recently, I've been spending a lot of time 
obsessing over the wealth aspect of self

improvement. I've watched hundreds of interviews 
with some of the wealthiest people in the world.

People who made hundreds of millions 
and even billions of dollars. And over
time I started to realize that the large majority

of them shared certain traits. These are the 
5 signs that you will become rich one day.
Starting off at

Number #1 – you are skeptical of the status quo. 
The status quo consists of all the beliefs that

society has drilled into you. Things like “oh you 
need to get a degree in order to succeed in life.”

or “just invest in a mutual fund 
and everything will be alright”
or even “don't start a business it's too risky”.

The problem with the status quo is that we 
live in a world that is constantly changing.

Which means that the best way to succeed 
in life nowadays was not the best way to

succeed in life last century. Think about it. 
Getting a degree wasn't something that the

average person really considered until 
a hundred years ago. Mutual funds were

invented only half (edit: cut out the word 
half)a century ago. And thousands of years

ago – for all of human history - literally 
every family had a business – yet we tell

people that it's too risky to try to start 
one now. The status quo changes all the time.

Those that become rich, question everything that 
they are taught. They realize that half of those

things are simply not true anymore. And this 
allows them to spot and jump into opportunities

way before other people. Which gives them 
a huge first movers advantage and also a

huge payoff if they are right.
Because you make the most money

betting on things that very few 
people are currently betting on.

Which actually brings us to Sign Number #2 - 
You like taking BIG BETS. Having conflicting

beliefs with the current status quo will not 
make you rich unless you bet on this belief.

And it can't just be a little toe dip in 
the water bet, it needs to be a BIG BET.

Warren Buffet's mentor – Benjamin Graham, who 
is also the author of the Intelligent Investor

(probably the most well known investing book 
in the world today) made a BIG BET on Geico

in 1948. He invested 700 thousand dollars 
into the company which eventually grew to

400 million dollars by 1972. This single 
BIG BET produced more gains for Graham

than all of his other investments 
throughout his entire life combined.

See contrary to popular belief. The large 
majority of the wealthiest people in the world

became wealthy by placing a few big bets. 
They didn't initially make their fortune by

diversifying and betting on 50 different 
things. They found an opportunity that

challenged the status quo. And put 
their money where their mouth is

by either betting a huge percentage of 
their time or their money on this idea.

BIG BET's are bets that can make you 
10x to 100x your initial investment.

Something that is simply not possible by betting 
on things that lie within the status quo.

However, as with all bets there 
is a lot of risk involved.

Which brings us to Sign Number 3 – 
which is that the rich are paranoid.

See making big bets on things 
that challenge the status quo

has a pretty high chance of failure. So 
you need to have some degree of paranoia

in order to think critically about 
the things that can go wrong.

The large majority of the rich don't become rich 
right off the bat by making the perfect call
their very first time. The large majority of them

had to bet big a couple of times often failing 
and failing until they hit the jackpot.

You need to be paranoid so that you 
can control your emotions and only bet

what you can afford to lose. Those that 
are not paranoid enough will often go

all in and bet 100% or even 
more than 100% of what they own,

and if they are wrong – it completely wipes them 
out. They have little to no chance to recover.

The rich don't play the game of life like this. 
They understand that no bet is for certain,

and their paranoia allows them to dive deep into 
the many many possible things that can go wrong

which gives them clearer vision. 
With this knowledge they end up

only betting what they can afford 
to lose so that if they are wrong,

they can save up again and make another big bet a 
couple of years down the line when they spot the

next opportunity. Getting rich is not about making 
the right bet everytime. It's about surviving long

enough so you that can make enough big bets 
to eventually hit the jackpot of a lifetime.

Being paranoid also helps when it comes 
to running businesses. The large majority

of working businesses fail due to unexpected 
obstacles. These are things that people have a

very hard time predicting like a pandemic. 
But if you are paranoid enough - you end

up taking precautions (such as having 
enough cash to last for an entire year)

which protects your business from getting 
wiped out even in worst case scenarios.

Which is why this video was brought to you with 
the help of the guys at Surfshark VPN. Internet

safety and security is one of those things 
that I'm extremely paranoid about. I'm always

wondering if someone is watching me putting in 
my credit card number especially if I'm traveling

and using public wifi's. On top of that I 
really don't like it when certain websites

track my activities and mine my data to create 
custom ads for things that they think I need.

Surfshark VPN helps me with all of this. They get 
rid of all of these problems by providing me with

an easy to use one-for-all solution. Surfshark 
turns you into an anonymous and hard to trace

online user. It also secures your data 
with industry leading encryption and the

most secure VPN protocols which gives me 
peace of mind when I'm using public wifi's

The fourth sign that you will be rich one day

is – if you are someone who 
takes action within seconds.

If you see an opportunity to make a big bet, 
you need to start taking action immediately.

And that's because if you wait 6 months 
it might not be that big of a bet anymore.

Others might have already found out about 
it. The rich understand this and make
quick moves when they spot opportunities.

When I first had the idea to start a 
YouTube channel I immediately started

thinking about a name. Within a day I had 
selected a name and created the channel.

The following day I wrote my first script. The 
day after that I revised it and recorded it.

And within a week I uploaded my 
very first video onto YouTube.

Had I waited years like most people do, I 
honestly don't think I would had as much success.

The number one reason why people don't take quick 
action is because they are scared of failure. The

rich, on the other hand, understand that failure 
is a good thing. They have what's called an

anti-fragility mindset – which basically means 
that failure and pain only makes them stronger.

If my first video did not do well on 
Youtube I would have simply learned

from it and tried to improve my next one. 
I want to fail fast so I can succeed fast.

And finally the fifth sign that you will 
become rich one day is that you are not

too sensitive. Emotions are good. They make 
us feel alive and they add color to life,

but they can also really screw up your ability to 
make the right moves when it comes to your wealth.

People who are too sensitive don't 
think with their brain. They act

with their heart. These are the people who 
sell their stocks when the markets are crashing

knowing that statistically it's 
usually the best time to buy.

These are people who give up on their business 
when they come across their first big obstacle

because the negative emotions that come 
with failure are too much for them.

You need to be able to turn off your emotions so 
that you can see clearly and stick to your plan.

In 2005 Michael Burry went against the 
status quo and found an opportunity

in the United States housing market. He 
made a big bet, a 1 billion dollar bet,

that the market would crash. And for the 
first couple of months – he was losing money.

Naturally, he was met with a lot of anger. His 
clients were calling him up demanding that he

sell. He was called an idiot, he was even sued. 
But through all of it he pushed the emotions

aside and stuck to the plan. When the market 
finally collapsed he 5x'ed his initial bet

making a profit of close to 3 billion dollars 
for his clients – and 500 million for himself.

This what happens when you learn to turn off 
your emotions and look at the world clearly.

And that's it – these are the 5 signs that 
you will become rich one day. Which one's

do you agree with or disagree with? Let me 
know in the comments down below, I'd love
